titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Benjamin Howser, James Taylor, William Harrison, Jr., Tarry Brown, William Clark, Lycurgus Hudson, and Jesse Hill, Indictment
CWG7396

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Anderson County
Benjamin, Howser, James Taylor Wm Harrison Jr, Tarry Brown, William Clark, Lycurgus BrownHudson, & Jesse Hill

The Grand Jury of Anderson County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Benjamin Houser, James Taylor, Wm Harrison Jr. Tarry Brown, William Clark, Lycurgus, Hudson, & Jesse Hill, of the crime of Murder.

Committed as follows -- The said Benjamin, Houser, James Taylor, Wm Harrison Jr, Terry Brown, William Clark, Lycurgus, Hudson, & Jessee Hill on the 5th day of July 1864. in the County aforesaid did feloniously and of His malice aforethought kill and murder John Ash by shooting Him with a gun or pistol against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

L. H. Noble
Atty for comlth

witnesses before the Jury
James Green
Benj Ash
Mary E. Spoonamore,

A true bill
R H Crossfield
Foreman of Grand Jury
Filed in Court and entered of record the 10th day of Novr. 1865
As clerk of the Anderson Circuit Court, I certify that the foregoing is a true copy of the Indictment &c found in theSaid ACourt at its November Term 1865
C H Fenwick, c, a, c, c

Anderson Ct. Ct.
Commlth of Ky
Agst } Indict
Benj. Houser &c
copy --
